column1: Hemophilia refers to a group of bleeding disorders in which blood clotting takes a long time.
Hemophilia is caused by the lack of clotting factor VIII or IX in the blood.
The main symptom of hemophilia is bleeding.
Most often, hemophilia is diagnosed after a person has an abnormal bleeding episode.
The most common treatment is to replace the missing clotting factor in the blood through a vein (intravenous infusions).
So, be sure to tell your surgeon that you have this disorder.
But some people have bleeding into the joints, which may limit their activity.
